law.catch_line: Road passing over or obstructed by dam.

text.section: Where a county road passes over a dam, the owner or occupier of the dam shall keep such dam in good order and at least fourteen (14) feet wide at the top. He shall also keep in good order a bridge of like width over the pierhead, floodgates or any waste cut through or around the dam and shall erect and keep in good order a strong railing on both sides of such bridges or dam.

Every owner of a dam built after 1914, which dam, or the race or ditch connected therewith, obstructs any county road by the backing of water or otherwise, shall whenever it is necessary for the safe and convenient crossing of the same, or the pond created thereby, build and keep in repair over the dam, pond, race or ditch, a bridge like that specified in subsection (1) of this section.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4322.
